title: Puppy Bowl XX
article:
At 2PM, February 11, The Puppy Bowl XX (20) was aired. This year, The Puppy Bowl partnered with Best Friends Animal Society. The Puppy Bowl is a Super-Bowl-like sport where puppies are on a miniature football field covered in dog toys, and they try to run to their touchdown zone while holding a dog toy. The two teams are “Ruff” and “Fluff”.



Let’s meet the dogs playing in this annual event:



TEAM RUFF:

Bark Purdy: Chihuahua mix

Stryker: Border Collie Mix

Vanessa: Yorkshire Terrier Mix

Guy Fureri: Shepherd and Poodle mix

Moosh: Australian Shepherd mix

Mr. Bean: Papillon mix

Lady Luck: Poodle



TEAM FLUFF:

Cronut: Shar-pei

Harvey: Pug

Francine: Pug

Beigne: Dachshund mix

Linus: Hound mix

Patrick Mabones: Hound mix

Fred: Terrier mix

Levi: Great Dane



The winner was Team Ruff! They pulled their way into victory with a 72-69 lead over team Fluff.



Moosh won the “MVP” Award, and Harvey won the underdog award. The MVP (Most Valuable Pup) award is for best plays in the game, and the underdog award is for laziest, most introverted dog. Harvey won this for taking a nap during the game. <3 Congratulations to both dogs!



Tater drove Team Ruff to victory with a final drive in the game during the last few seconds!



Also, making a special appearance, Travis Klawse and his girlfriend Taylor Sniffed!



Thanks for reading my recap and summary of the Puppy Bowl XX!
author: Marshall Friedman
